Posts.Content: Hi everyone. Have been just trying to get my life bac together after having a double mastectomy with lymph node clearance in Feb and just finished rads two wks ago. Underarm area felt a little tender so I decided to have a feel and discovered a small lump. I'm absolutely sick with fear and panic and  thinking the worst. I don't understand how I cud have a lump if I had all my lymph nodes removed from that area.
Posts.Title: Found lump under arm 5 months after double mastectomy and lymph node...

Posts.Content: Thanks gay its just so frightening when you find a lump again so soon. I know it cud be something innocent but I automatically fear the worst. Feeling a bit more calm this morning. I was in contact with my nurse this morning so just waiting for a call back. I didn't have reconstruction. I had a double mastectomy with auxiliary clearance. Thanks for taking the time to get back to me x
Posts.Title: Found lump under arm 5 months after double mastectomy and lymph node...

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, just back from meeting with the breast consultant. He examined me and has agreed that their is a definite lump. He said that he is a bit concerned and will need to carry out an ultra sound next week. I'm absolutely devastated and just feel so deflated. I've only just finished 20 sessions of radiotherapy 2 weeks ago. I've just had my 14th dose of herceptin on Tuesday. How can this be
Posts.Title: Found lump under arm 5 months after double mastectomy and lymph node...

Posts.Content: Hello wombat.23 I had a bilateral mastectomy last week. I'm waiting to hear results from that and I am just so terrified. I know what you mean about making time for your children I'm doing the same, less housework more play. Deep down I fear I won't be here to see them grow up and I just can't bare the thought. I'm 29 years old. I know that I have nodes involved but don't know how many yet. Are you finished with treatment
Posts.Title: Feeling deflated

Posts.Content: Thanks optimistic it's nice to know that I am not the only one growing through this. I think being a mum makes it much harder. I've 2 under 5 and they just need me so much. I feel so guilty putting them through this. I know that sounds silly but I do. I wish their little childhoods could be perfect and carefree. Everyone says it gets easier I just hope that is true. X
Posts.Title: Feeling deflated

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone I am feeling much brighter and more positive today. I would say this is the first day after surgery that I've been feeling more like myself. Surgery took more out of me than I was expecting but it's upwards and onwards today again. It's a rollercoaster ride that none of us ladies want to be on. As you say jo it's gaining back that bit of perspective. Results tomorrow which I'm not looking forward to but il deal with that then too. Tomorrow is another day as they say.Hope everyone is keeping good. Thanks everyone I just needed a bit of a meltdown sometimes it's good to let it out xx
Posts.Title: Feeling deflated

Posts.Content: Feeling very down and can't come to grips with my grade3, stage 3 her2+ breast cancer diagnosis. Feeling like my life will never be the same again. I don't want to worry my family or friends so I keep a brave face on most of the time but inside I'm terrified.
Posts.Title: Feeling deflated

Posts.Content: Thanks optimistic I had been doing great and was feeling positive but lately I feel like I've hit a wall. Nobody deserves to go through this nightmare. You wudnt wish it upon your worst enemy. Take care and thanks again x
Posts.Title: Feeling deflated

Posts.Content: Thanks worried2016 it's so so hard. It's just so heartbreaking when I think my lovely life with my little family as I know it will never be the same again. I just can't cope with the thought of not being here for my children growing up. Hopefully with more time il get to grips with this but it's just so so hard. Hope you are doing good x
Posts.Title: Feeling deflated

Posts.Content: Thanks gay you are awfully young aswell. Taking each day as it comes sounds good. I think it's too much for anyone to think any further at the min. Hope that you are getting through the chemo okay that can't be easy. You will be glad to be halfway. I think the anaesthetic has really had an effect on me I've been feeling really down since surgery and I can't shake it . Hopefully I be feeling bac to myself in no time each day as it comes ..................................... Take care xxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling deflated
